Leon Foster

1924-2018

Leon Foster passed away peacefully Tuesday evening December 11, 2018, in Independence, Kansas, with family members by his side. He was 94. He was born in McCune, Kansas, August 2, 1924, to Marie (Tridle) and Earl Foster. At McCune High School he excelled as a student and an athlete in track and football. After graduation in 1943 he immediately joined the Navy and served his country during World War II until 1946 as a hydraulics engineer building turrets for aircraft bombers.

After returning home, he attended Kansas State Teachers College in Pittsburg where he graduated with a bachelors and masterâs degree in teaching and coaching and an E.S. degree in administration. He also played football for the college from 1946-1948.

He spent his entire professional career in education. He taught high school and coached many different sports in Kincaid, Sedan, Cedar Vale and Fort Scott, Kansas. He was a principal at Turner High School and returned to Fort Scott to become Dean of Fort Scott Community College and later became the college president. He moved to Independence, Kansas later in his career to become the president of the Independence Community College before retiring in 1986. Throughout his career he touched the lives of thousands of young students and athletes, employees and colleagues.

After retiring he and his wife Earline became active members in the Kansas and International Airstream organization. During their over 25 years of participation they saw the world pulling their travel trailer to Mexico, Newfoundland, Alaska, Canada and all corners of the US. For nearly 30 years they would travel with their trailer to South Texas and spend their winter months with friends.

Leon is survived by his wife Earline Foster of Independence, Kansas, his sister Gloria Wintjen of Joplin, Missouri, his son Stephen Foster of Jackson, Wyoming, and daughter Joan Foster of South Padre Island, Texas. He also has 3 stepchildren Luann Baker, Steven Wulz, and Curtis Wulz. There are also many step-grandchildren and step-greatgrandchildren.

Funeral services will be held at 10:00 AM Monday, December 17th, at the Cheney Witt Chapel, Fort Scott, Kansas. Burial will follow in the U. S. National Cemetery in Fort Scott. They will again receive friends from 3:00 until 5:00 Sunday afternoon at the Cheney Witt Chapel, Fort Scott. Memorials are suggested to the Red Cross and may be left in care of the Cheney Witt Chapel, P.O. Box 347, 201 S. Main St., Fort Scott, Kansas 66701. Words of remembrance may be submitted to the online guestbook at cheneywitt.com.

Local preparation performed by Zach Webb Family Funeral Service.

Leitha J. Sewell

1923-2018

Leitha Jean Sewell, age 95, of Independence, passed away, Tuesday, December 4, 2018, at Wilson County Medical Center in Neodesha.

A private family memorial service will be held at a later date. The family has requested memorial contributions be made to Animals With Our Love (AWOL) and sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Leitha Jean Sewell was born May 21, 1923, in Canton, KS, to Mabel Christine (Austin) and Jeremiah Simpson Brucker. She grew up in Galva, KS, and graduated from high school in Canton. In 1945, she married Mason Leroy Sewell. Mr. Sewell preceded her in death in July, 1995.

Mr. Sewell was in the oil and construction business and Leitha was a homemaker. The family lived in Kansas, Ohio, Louisiana and Colorado. She later worked in watercraft manufacturing in Ohio and at Cobalt Boats in Neodesha, KS. After that, she worked at the library in Altoona, KS. The couple belonged to the VFW in Neodesha. Leitha enjoyed gardening, cooking and her family.

Survivors include: Three children; Terry Mason (Donna) Sewell, Sr., of Independence, KS. Connie (Larry) Green, Of Independence, KS. Randy Lee Sewell, of Altoona, KS. Four grandchildren; Jeannie Lee Lindley, Dallas, TX. Christina Marie Howard, Tulsa, OK. Terry Mason Sewell, Jr., Neodesha, KS. Nicole Renea Sewell, Independence, KS. Six great-grandchildren,, numerous great-great-grandchildren and a large extended family. In addition she had six step great-grandchildren. Two preceded her in death, Mason Robert Lewis Green, son of Jeff and Monica Green and Nicole Jolicoeur, daughter of Kim Green and Scott Jolicoeur.

She was preceded in death by her husband, parents, and siblings; Willard, Russell, Garland, Mary, Robert, Nona Irene and Evelyn Brucker.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

Kay Essig

1960-2018

Kay Essig, age 58, of Independence, passed away Thursday, November 15, at her home.

Memorial celebration of life services will be held at 2:00 PM, Saturday, November 24, at Zach Webb Family Funeral Service with Zach Webb officiating. Visitation will begin at 1:00 PM. Memorial contributions to Animals With Our Love (AWOL) may be sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Cosett Kay Whittley Essig was born January 17, 1960, in Parsons, KS, to Ralph and Marian Rose (Perry) Whittley, Sr. She grew up and went to school in Parsons. In 1978, she married John Ingalsbe and they later divorced. She later married Riley Essig and they later divorced. Kay worked as a CNA at Eagle Estates and Good Samaritan in Parsons. She worked at Emerson Electric in Independence from 1996 until they closed. In 1999, she began her employment at Standard Motors in Independence.

Survivors include: Her children; Shawn Whittley of Independence, and Jennifer Shull of Coffeyville. Siblings; Junior Whittley, Randy Whittley, Willie Whitley, George Whittley, John Whittley, Carolyn Housley, and Peggy Kepley. Grandchildren: Dominick Ferrell and Mason Whittley. Numerous extended family.

She was preceded in death by her parents. Sisters; Cassie Anderson, Patricia McGinnis and Rose Marie Whittley. Grandchildren: Steven Whittley, Cody Shull, and Kylie Jo Whittley.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

To the family of Kay Essig May our thoughts and prayers be with you all. Galdina Ramirez and Nana Mateer

Gary L. Main

1939-2018

Gary L. Main, age 79, of Independence, passed away Sunday, November 18, 2018, at Montgomery Place after a battle with mesothelioma.

Memorial visitation will be held at 10AM to 12PM Saturday, November 24, 2018, with a Celebration of Life at 11AM at Zach Webb Family Funeral Service. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions for a family memorial project at the park may be made to the funeral home and sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS, 67301.

Gary Lynn Main was born February 6, 1939, in Independence, KS, to Oren and Vera (Harris) Main. Attacked by viral polio at the tender age of 6, his life changed forever yet his strength and perseverance never wavered. He attended local schools. Gary attended cosmetology school in Kansas City. Gary married Carolea McDowell in 1962 and the couple founded Gary and Cary's Hair Salon and operated it for many years. Gary later married Susan Thornton Hastings in 1984 and she survives. Gary was later an inspector for the Kansas Board of Cosmetology until his retirement.

Gary never met a stranger, never had an enemy, and was thought of kindly by all that knew him. Gary's sense of humor was second to none and he found the positive in everything. He enjoyed his friends and family as a dedicated husband, dad and papa. His absence will be greatly felt and the fond, hilarious memories will overwhelm the ones he touched, forever.

Survivors include: Wife: Susan Main. Two children, Drew (Tiffany) Main, Cherryvale, KS, and Heather (Jason) Dillard, Springfield, MO. Brothers; Don Main, Bill Main, and Roger Main. Grandchildren: Katelynn Main, Chance Main, Declan Dillard, and Hadley Dillard.

He was preceded in death by his parents, and siblings: Steven Main, Craig Main, Tanya Main and Marlene Stolte.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

Hazel McClellan was born June 16, 1971, in Coffeyville, KS to Irene Pauline Allen. She graduated in 1989 from Field Kindley High School. She enjoyed bingo and writing.

Survivors include: Children; Dakota D. Davis, Frederick Green, Tyrone Green, Bryson Green and Isaiah Grundy. Three brothers; Billy, Mike and Mark McClellan. Nieces, nephews and extended family. She was preceded in death by her mother and a brother, Ricky McClellan.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

Dennis Lee "Dugan" Frazier

1956-2018

Dennis L. "Dugan" Frazier, age 62, passed away Saturday, November 3, 2018, at Labette Health Center in Parsons, KS.

Graveside memorial services will be held at 2:00 PM, Friday, November 9, 2018, at Mt. Hope Cemetery in Independence with Steve Aemisegger and Zach Webb officiating. A celebration of life will follow at the American Legion Post 139. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to Animals With Our Love (AWOL) and sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Dennis Frazier was born March 29, 1956, in Independence, KS, to Sherman and Mary (Dennis) Frazier. He attended local schools. He was active in local bowling, softball and golf leagues. He loved his Jayhawks, Chiefs and Royals. He often played bass guitar alongside his brother, Steve. He was a proud member of the Osage Nation.

Dennis is survived by a niece and nephew: Jennifer (Kenneth) Driskill, Newton, KS, and Brent (Hope) Avery, Anderson, SC. He was preceded in death by his parents, a sister, Kathy Avery, and his brother Steve Frazier.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

Steve Wayne Jimmerson

1962, 2018

Kathy A. (Gann) Jimmerson, 59, formerly of Independence, and her husband, Steve W. Jimmerson, 55, of Dodge City, KS, passed away October 4, 2018, in an accident near Ellsworth, KS.

A service was held in Dodge City on October 12. A memorial celebration of life visitation and service will be held from 2:00-4:00 PM, Saturday, October 27, 2018, at Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to Animals With Our Love (AWOL) and sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS, 67301.

Kathy was born November 22, 1957, in Independece, KS, to Gene and Doris Gann. She attended Independence schools. She was a CMA over 30 years and worked for Trinity Manor in Dodge City for over 20 years.

Steve was born December 12, 1962, in Pittsburg, TX, to Herbert and Mary Jimmerson. He attended Daingerfield, TX schools and was a journeyman tree trimmer for 40 years.

Ther were married July 25, 1997.

Kathy's survivors include her father, Gene Gann: daughter, Carrie Grossman; brothers, Charley and Laurie Gann and David and Linda Gann. She was preceded in death by her mother, Doris Gann.

Steve's survivors include his mother, Mary Jimmerson; daughter, Chelsea Bucholz; five sisters, Diane, Brenda, Donna, Debbie and Vicki: and one grandson. He was preceded in death by his father, Herbert Jimmerson. They are also survived by extended family and their Boston Terriers.

1927-2018

Alice Taylor Jones, age 91, of Independence, passed away Monday, October 15, 2018.

Memorial services will be held at a later date. Memorial contributions to the family may be made and sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Alice Taylor Jones was born February 19, 1927, in Clarksburg, MO, to Clarence and Bessie (Winebrenner) Eckels. In 1945 she married Charles Taylor and he preceded her in death. Later, she married Wayne Jones and he preceded her in death. Alice had worked as a cook for several nursing homes. She belonged to several bowling leagues and was a member of the Church of Christ in Independence. She enjoyed gardening and her many grandchildren.

Survivors of Alice include: Seven children; Donald Taylor, Sedan, KS. Nancy Davis, of California. Danny Taylor, Norma Lauts, and Barbara Saxby, all of Illinois. Linda Breeden, of Texas. Brenda Elsessor, Independence, KS. Numerous grandchildren, great-grandchildren, great-great-grandchildren and extended family.

Alice was preceded in death by her parents, two husbands, and four grandsons.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

Ricky Martin

1980-2018

Ricky Antonio Martin, age 38, of Independence, passed away October 11, 2018, at his home.

Celebration of life services will be held at 1:00 PM, Friday, October 26, 2018 at Zach Webb Family Funeral Service. Interment will follow at Mt. Hope Cemetery. Memorial contributions for the family may be sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Ricky Antonio Martin was born June 22, 1980, in Pine Bluff, AR, to Baybra Martin and Lillie Hayes. He graduated High School in Muskogee, OK. He had worked as a cook at Down Home Family Restaurant. Ricky was an outgoing person.

Survivors include: his brother, Stevie D. Logan of Coffeyville, KS, and a sister, Felicia Smith Logan of Independence. A stepson, Demaurice Dunn. Extended family and many friends.

He was preceded in death by his parents, and two brothers, Willie Hayes and James A. Logan, Jr.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

Deborah Lynn "Deb" Sandoval

1955-2018

Deborah L. "Deb" Sandoval, age 63, of Independence, passed away Sunday, September 16, 2018, in Overland Park, KS.

Memorial celebration of life services will be held in the Wesley Center of the First United Methodist Church in Independence at 3:30 PM, Saturday, September 29, 2018, with Jim Mosley officiating. Visitation will begin at 3:00 PM. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to the Deb Sandoval Theatre Education Fund or Animals With Our Love (AWOL) and sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Deb Sandoval was born July 31, 1955, in Independence, KS, to Gene and Mary Lee (Adams) Garrison. She was raised in Independence, attending Lincoln Elementary School, Independence Junior High, Independence High School and Independence Community College. She received her Bachelor's in Secondary Spanish Education and her Master's Degree in Education, Summa Cum Laude, from Pittsburg State University.

Deb had worked at flower shops in Independence and Coffeyville, including Hasselman's and Jan L's. She had been employed at ICC in various positions, Four County Mental Health, the Neosho, MO, school district and Independence, KS, USD 446. She was a lifetime member of VFW post 1186 Auxillary, Delta Kappa Gamma and Delta Psi Omega, The Dramatist's Guild, Kansas Writer's Association, National Education Association and the Kansas Education Association,

Deb's passion was drama and theater. She was active in Children's Summer Theater, Montgomery County Theater Group, Independence Community College and the Inge Festival, numerous Neewollah productions (co-directing Damn Yankees in 2015) in all aspects of production, direction, writing and acting. She had written numerous plays and scripts. Kansas City Theater Company performed "Dear Independence, Love, Saigon", which was also chosen for the first Play Lab and the William Inge Festival. "Extra Ketchup, Hot Flashes and Rum" was performed many times locally. Deb won multiple Anna Awards at ICC and was the author of numerous works. Deb appeared in the movie, "The Sublime and the Beautiful", and did script work for the film, "The Majestic".

Deb was an award winning chili cook in the 4-state area and won a horse as a prize in the Good News Cooking Contest, wrote a cookbook, "Stirring Up Memories...with a dash of love", and catered dinner theaters. Deb loved music and animals and was a "good ol' hippie chick". She will be missed by all.

In 1973, at the Chapel of Praise in Independence, she married Rodger Hinthorn and they later divorced. Deb later married Victor Sandoval and they later divorced.

Survivors of Deb Sandoval include: Her daughter, Haley Hinthorn, of Independence. Father, Gene Garrison, of Independence. Her brother, Mark (Rebecca) Garrison, and her niece, Addy, of Puyallup, WA. Aunts, uncles, cousins, extended family and vast multitude of friends.

She was preceded in death by her mother, Mary Garrison, in January, 2018.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

Halley, I am so sorry to hear about your mother. I didn't know until today or I would have been there at the funeral. I know how awful this feels. Please call me anytime or if you need anything let me know. I will be here for you. I guess Debbie and David can't see what is going on in heaven and set up a theatre. Love you. -- Connie Sherlock

Sharilyn "Sherry" Faye Tackkett

1952-2018

Sharilyn "Sherry" Faye Tackkett, age 65, of Independence, passed away Tuesday, September 11, 2018, at her home.

Graveside celebration of life services will be held at 10:00 AM, Friday, September 14, 2018, at the Veteran's Gazebo in Fairview Cemetery with interment in Restlawn Cemetery, both in Coffeyville, KS, with Zach Webb officiating. Friends may register at Zach Webb Family Funeral Service on Thursday from 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM. Memorial contributions to the charity of the donor's choice may be sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Sherry Tackkett was born October 2, 1952, in Coffeyville, KS, to Winfield and Leola (Kallenberger) Bloomfield. She was raised and went to school in Coffeyville, attending Field Kindley High School. On June 10, 1972, she married Steve L. Seger in Coffeyville. Mr. Seger passed away in 1989. On November 1, 1992, she married Rollie Tackkett, in Miami, OK, and he survives at the home.

Sherry had worked at JC Penney's and Foodtown in Coffeyville and The Medicine Shoppe and Dr. Beaver's office in Independence. She had been active in the PTO, Bluebirds, and bowling leagues. She enjoyed ceramics, reading, hunting and fishing. Sherry especially loved her grandchildren.

Survivors of Sherry Tackkett, in addition to her husband, Rollie, of the home, include: Her children; Jason Seger and Robin Seger, both of Independence, KS. Amy Jaimez, of Lawrence, KS. Melissa Tackkett, of Independence, KS. Christy O'Connell, of New Jersey. One sister, Marilyn Hogard, of Frontenac, KS. One sister-in-law, Charlotte Bloomfield Pressler, of Independence, KS. Sixteen grandchildren and three great-grandchildren.

She was preceded in death by her parents, husband, Steve, her daughter, Angie Seger Maddy, and a brother, Carl Scott Bloomfield.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

My thoughts and prayers are with you and your family. I love you all. -- Cindy Ehrlich

***************************************************************************************

Norma Rhea Schmidt-Heon

1936-2018

Norma Rhea Schmidt-Heon, age 82, formerly of Independence, passed away May 24, 2018, in Lakewood, CO.

Graveside memorial celebration of life services will be held at 11:00 AM, Monday, September 3, 2018, at the Lutheran Cemetery at Mt. Hope. Memorial contributions on behalf of the family may be sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Norma was born January 23, 1936, in Independence, KS, to Anton and Lorene Schmidt. She attended Zion Lutheran Grade School and graduated Independence High School in 1954. Norma won several beauty pageants and was homecoming queen. She worked at Sinclair Oil as office secretary to the vice president. She moved to Denver, CO, as executive assistant to the proposed Magic Mountain which became Heritage. There she met Wallace Oakes and they were married and had three daughters. In 1979, she joined Marquette Minerals and wed Raymond Heon, who preceded her in death in 2011.

Norma was a president of Molholm Elementary PTA, a Campfire Girls Leader, District 2 Campfire Girls Director, member or the bowling league, Ladies Golf Association of Lakewood Country Club, Junior Golf Association, was president of the Colorado Women's Golf Association, winning several championships. She played guitar, sang, traveled and painted amazing and beautiful paintings of nature. She remained true to her Lord and Savior. Norma is deeply loved and missed.

Survivors of Norma Heon include: Three daughters; Lori Emery, Lexington, KY. Darcy Nelson, Wheatridge, CO. Stacy McClure, Aurora, CO. One brother, Edward Schmidt, Eureka Springs, AR. Seven grandchildren, a great-granddaughter and a great-grandson. She was preceded in death by her parents, two husbands, and a brother, Kurtis Schmidt.

Norma Rhea Schmidt-Heon. .I recently learned of the passing of Norma. I am so sorry. She and I were best friends in high school in Independence. Reading her obituary, I was so impressed with what a wonderful life she led and how accomplished she was in many areas. Please extend my heart felt condolences to her family.. -- Dorothy Sanders Terhune

Charles S. "Chuck" Ives, Jr.

1967-2018

Charles Stanley "Chuck" Ives, Jr., age 51, of Independence, passed away Sunday, August 26, 2018, near Bartlesville, OK.

Memorial graveside celebration of life and Military Graveside Rites by American Legion and VFW will be held at 10 AM, Saturday, September 1, 2018, at Mt. Hope Cemetery with Zach Webb officiating. Memorial contributions to the American Legion Post 139 or VFW Post 1186 may be sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301. The family will receive friends following the service for lunch at the American Legion.

Charles Stanley "Chuck" Ives, Jr., was born June 16, 1967, in Omaha, NE, to Marie "Mickey" (Truman) and Charles S. Ives, Sr. The family moved to Coffeyville, KS, in 1973, where he was raised and graduated Field Kindley High School in 1984. Chuck enlisted in the US Army and was stationed in Korea. He was a lifetime member of VFW Post 1186 and a member of American Legion Post 139. He had attended ICC and truck driving school in Ft. Scott, KS, and became an OTR Truck Driver. He had also worked at Ashcraft Tire for 8 years. His passion was helping veterans and he had worked on the military funeral detail. He especially enjoyed fishing and all that comes with it.

Survivors of Chuck Ives include: His companion, Christine Franklin, of Independence, KS. One son, Charles S. Ives, III, of Indiana. Four siblings; Gene Melies, Canon City, CO. Daniel Melies, Phoenix, AZ. Paul Melies, Coffeyville, KS. Patricia Bartholomew, Apache Junction, AZ, and a large extended family and friends.

He was preceded in death by his parents and two sisters, Donna Jo Melies, and Linda Marie Ives.

The family has entrusted the arrangement of services to Zach and Dee Webb of locally-owned Zach Webb Family Funeral Service of Independence.

Howard Hester

Howard Hester, age 52, of Independence, passed away Sunday, August 12, 2018, at Wilson County Medical Center.

Memorial celebration of life graveside services will be held at 10 AM Saturday, August 25, 2018, at Liberty Cemetery in Liberty, KS, with Zach Webb officiating. Memorial contributions for the family may be sent to Zach Webb Family Funeral Service, 1475 S. 10th, Independence, KS 67301.

Howard Charles Hester was born November 9, 1965, in Coffeyville, KS, to Howard L. and Evelyn (Malone) Hester. He was raised and went to school in Independence and Caney. He had worked for the city of Independence at Mt. Hope Cemetery and later owned J & H Tire Shop and worked in construction and repair. Robert (Bob) D. Lane, (better known as âRockyâ to those he went to high school with). He leaves behind a mountain of what he considered to be valuables and treasures. He loved garage sales and an avid auction goer. Those that knew him, loved him. He had an infectious way of bringing out the best in people. H e loved to tell his tales and stories about everything from his childhood, to fishing, hunting and his wood carvings. He loved to garden and making pickles, which included his famous pickled okra. He also loved to cook and was famous for his blackened fish, grilled steaks and fried potatoes . The different hobbies that he went through included golfing, motorcycles, boating, skiing, camping, jewelry making and wood carving. He loved attending the races and going to the coffee shop every morning in Caney. He raised St. Bernard dogs for many years. You would never see him without a toothpick in his mouth and one in his hat for later.

He was a very active member of the Kansas Jaycees. He was Chapter President and State Director while with the Osage City Jaycees. He began a Jaycee Chapter and was the Chapter President in Pleasanton. While he was with the Pleasanton Jaycees, he was JCI Senator and State Vice President. He was initiated April 2, 1974 as a Shriner by Eureka Lodge No. 88, A.F.&A.M., Pleasanton. He was also a member of the Lions Club, American Legion and was a Sergeant E5 in the United States Army.

On February 12, 1961 he married the love of his life, Marleen K. Trebbe. He went to work as a heavy equipment operator and poured concrete in Osage City until he had to change occupations due to a back injury. He then became an insurance agent for Farm Bureau in Osage City. He was promoted to agency manager for Linn County, which led to a move to Pleasanton. Within a few short years he was promoted to agency manager for Montgomery County, which led to a move to Independence. He left Farm Bureau to open his own independent agency with George Van Dyne forming the Van Dyne Lane Insurance Agency in Independence. After retiring as an insurance agent he worked at Decker Construction as a general maintenance worker. Bob earned numerous trips while working with Farm Bureau taking the family to many parts of the United States and Canada. Bob and Marleen loved to dance and enjoyed their 5 oâclock happy hour. For the last 25 years they enjoyed being âWinter Texansâ in Weslaco, Texas.

He is survived by his loving wife of 56 years, Marleen, and two daughters, Brenda Lane of Portland, TN, and Teresa McVey and her husband Ron, of Tyro. Seven grandchildren, and seventeen great grandchildren, along with several nieces and nephews. Two brothers, Tom Lane, Osage City and Gary Lane, Burlington, and one sister, Darlene Haskins, Osage City. He held a very special relationship with Betty Gonzalez, Torreon, Mexico, Teresaâs exchange student.

He was proceeded in death by his parents William and Alice Lane, his step-father John Black, two sisters Coleen Keeffe and Maxine Criqui.

Gerry's childhood began on a family farm outside of Independence where she attended Wayside Country School in first and second grades. Her family then moved into the town of Independence where she attended Washington School, Independence Junior High and graduated from Independence High School in 1949. Upon her graduation, she attended Independence Community Junior College. She earned her associates degree in secretarial administration in 1951. After earning her associates degree, she was employed by Sinclair Oil Company, later, ARCO Pipeline, in Independence as an administrative secretary for 40 years (1951-1991). During her tenure at ARCO, she earned her Certified Professional Secretary Certification.

In 1952, she married David Lincoln Moore, a long-time barber in Independence (David Moore's Barbershop). They were married for 52 years until his death in 2004. They had one daughter, Gail Diana Moore Woltkamp.

Gerry loved the town of Independence where she was a member of the First Christian Church, active in the Mercy Hospital Auxiliary, the Independence Historical Museum, FORPAZ and Neewollah Cast Party planning committees for many years. She was also a long-time member of the local chapter of Beta Sigma Phi and she enjoyed helping with her IHS class of '49 reunions. Gerry lived in Independence until 2012 when she moved to Kearney, Missouri to be closer to family.

Gerry is survived by a daughter, Gail Woltkamp, a son-in-law, Bill Woltkamp, of Kearney, Missouri, and two grandsons, Ryan Moore Woltkamp, Maryville, MO and Grant Joseph Woltkamp, Kearney, MO. William D. Webb

1925-2017

William D. Webb, age 92, of Lakewood, CO, formerly of Independence, passed away Wednesday, September 20, 2017.

William was born July 10, 1925 in Independence, Kansas, to Glen M. and Mary Ellen (Williamson) Webb, the founders of Webb Funeral Home. He graduated from Independence High School and enlisted in the Army Air Corps at the age of 19, fighting in World War II in Europe as a member of a B-17 bomber crew with the 99th Bomb Group as a ball turret gunner. Upon returning to the states, he graduated from the University of Kansas with a B.S. in Architecture, before returning to Independence in 1951 to marry his high school sweetheart, Patricia Harris, to whom he was happily married for 66 and ½ years until his death.

William relocated to Denver in 1960 and then to Lakewood, working for James Sudler Associates (Denver Art Museum) before William started his own, highly successful architectural firm, which he ran for 35 years before retiring in 2007. His firm was the architects for Penn Manor and Glenwood Estate in Independence, among others. He was also an active member in several churches in the Denver area, most recently Grace Fellowship of Lakewood, as well as Kiwanis and the American Institute of Architects. He enjoyed sports, in particular golf and baseball (fan of the Cardinals and Yankees), along with traveling throughout the U.S., and being both a loving husband and a wonderful father. Most importantly, he was a deeply spiritual man, with a strong faith in the Lord Jesus Christ that permeated everything he did and influenced his relationships with others.

He is survived by his wife Patricia Webb, of Lakewood, CO. Sons: Tom Webb (daughter-in-law Laura) and Dan Webb. Grandchildren; Megan, Amy and Todd and great-grandchildren Riley and Josie (mother Amy and father Ryan). He was preceded in death by his father Glen and mother Mary, and his brothers Clarence Webb, Richard Webb and Gerald Webb.

Funeral services for William will be held this Wednesday, September 27 at 11:30 a.m. at the Newcomer Funeral Home at 901 S. Sheridan Blvd in Lakewood (visitation starts there at 10:30 a.m.), followed by a burial at Ft. Logan National Cemetery starting at 1:30 p.m.

In lieu of flowers, the family is requesting that donations be made out to Grace Fellowship of Lakewood or HOW 101 (supporting at risk children and young mothers in Uganda).
